channel.title: Comments on: Shoes inspired by Stephin Merritt?

item.title: By: Trott
item.dc:creator: Trott
item.description:
I know I'm only two months late to the party, but...
Stephin Merritt to Travis Barker:
Stephin Merritt and Miho Hatori on "Lindy-Lou" from Hyacinths & Thistles....
...Miho Hatori and Tina Weymouth on "19-2000" by Gorillaz on the self-titled album...
...Tina Weymouth, Adrian Belew, and Brian Eno on "Born Under Punches (The Heat Goes On)" by the Talking Heads from Remain In Light...
...Belew and Eno on David Bowie's "Red Sails" from Lodger...
...Bowie with Reeves Gabrels on the Tin Machine record...
...Reeves Gabrels with Robert Smith on "A Sign Of God" from the Orgazmo soundtrack...
...Robert Smith on Blink-182's "All Of This" with Travis Barker from Blink -182' self-titled album.
What do I win?
http://tinyurl.com/5zeh2j (musicroutes.com for all your Six Degrees of Stephin Merritt needs)
item.content:encoded:
I know I’m only two months late to the party, but…

Stephin Merritt to Travis Barker:

Stephin Merritt and Miho Hatori on “Lindy-Lou” from Hyacinths & Thistles….

…Miho Hatori and Tina Weymouth on “19-2000” by Gorillaz on the self-titled album…

…Tina Weymouth, Adrian Belew, and Brian Eno on “Born Under Punches (The Heat Goes On)” by the Talking Heads from Remain In Light…

…Belew and Eno on David Bowie’s “Red Sails” from Lodger…

…Bowie with Reeves Gabrels on the Tin Machine record…

…Reeves Gabrels with Robert Smith on “A Sign Of God” from the Orgazmo soundtrack…

…Robert Smith on Blink-182’s “All Of This” with Travis Barker from Blink -182′ self-titled album.

What do I win?

http://tinyurl.com/5zeh2j (musicroutes.com for all your Six Degrees of Stephin Merritt needs)

item.title: By: Big City Sheep
item.dc:creator: Big City Sheep
item.description: "Immolated pop punk drummers..."--nice one, K. A tip line? I don' t know--I was online when I heard and my first thought was Drawer B. My mind, it is warped. Six degrees of separation from Stephin Merritt to Travis Barker?
item.content:encoded:
“Immolated pop punk drummers…”–nice one, K.
A tip line? I don’ t know–I was online when I heard and my first thought was Drawer B. My mind, it is warped. Six degrees of separation from Stephin Merritt to Travis Barker?

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Big City Sheep: Saw the news. Thanks for letting us know. Are you trying to tell us we need a "tip line" or place for submissions so that random comments about immolated pop punk drummers can be shared?
item.content:encoded: Big City Sheep: Saw the news. Thanks for letting us know. Are you trying to tell us we need a “tip line” or place for submissions so that random comments about immolated pop punk drummers can be shared?

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: I can't take complete credit for twug. My friends Ryan and Greg came up with it one night in San Francisco (circa '00) while we were attending an indie rock show at Bottom of the Hill. Twug was to denote someone who was more indie-rock than indie-pop (twee) but not quite punk or emo. We had very elaborately developed twug personas. San Francisco was full of them. Probably still is.
item.content:encoded: I can’t take complete credit for twug. My friends Ryan and Greg came up with it one night in San Francisco (circa ’00) while we were attending an indie rock show at Bottom of the Hill. Twug was to denote someone who was more indie-rock than indie-pop (twee) but not quite punk or emo. We had very elaborately developed twug personas. San Francisco was full of them. Probably still is.

item.title: By: Logan K. Young
item.dc:creator: Logan K. Young
item.description: They are some spiffy lookin' kicks, indeed. And tip of the hat to your Herr Kerry for "twugster." I'm totally using that!
item.content:encoded: They are some spiffy lookin’ kicks, indeed. And tip of the hat to your Herr Kerry for “twugster.” I’m totally using that!

item.title: By: Big City Sheep
item.dc:creator: Big City Sheep
item.description: ETA: 4 were killed. 2 were injured. (Barker was one of the injured.)
item.content:encoded: ETA: 4 were killed. 2 were injured. (Barker was one of the injured.)

item.title: By: Big City Sheep
item.dc:creator: Big City Sheep
item.description: A plane crashed at Columbia Metropolitan Airport. One of its occupants was Travis Barker. I have no idea why I'm posting this here.
item.content:encoded: A plane crashed at Columbia Metropolitan Airport. One of its occupants was Travis Barker. I have no idea why I’m posting this here.
